citations.narrative:
The current large outdoor pen has two large holes in the ground that are a hazard to the dogs and need to be addressed.
One hole is covered with some siding material but not secured down and was shifted, exposing the hole. These are deep
holes that could pose a potential hazard to the dogs and need to be addressed to keep the enclosure in good repair.
Correct by: Oct 11, 2023

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There was an accumulation of flies and stink bugs throughout the facility. The facility does not have any current program
in place that would mitigate or control the number of insects around the kennel. This needs to be addressed and a pest
control program in place for the overall health of the dogs.
Correct by: Oct 6, 2023

The licensee is not currently following the program of vet care which states that dogs hair coats should be checked
weekly. A female cavalier identified as “Mathilda” was in the whelping box and had heavily matted ears and matted fur
along the back legs. The extensive nature of these matted ears indicate they are over a week old and were not identified
or addressed by the licensee. Weekly checks allow these dogs to be identified and have preventative care provided in the
manner of grooming to reduce matted fur. The licensee needs to follow his veterinarians plan for the health of the dog.
Correct by: Oct 5, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The current large outdoor pen has two large holes in the ground that are a hazard to the dogs and need to be addressed. 
One hole is covered with some siding material but not secured down and was shifted, exposing the hole. These are deep 
holes that could pose a potential hazard to the dogs and need to be addressed to keep the enclosure in good repair.  
Correct by: Oct 11, 2023 
3.11(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
There was an accumulation of flies and stink bugs throughout the facility. The facility does not have any current program 
in place that would mitigate or control the number of insects around the kennel. This needs to be addressed and a pest 
control program in place for the overall health of the dogs.  
Correct by: Oct 6, 2023 
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee is not currently following the program of vet care which states that dogs hair coats should be checked 
weekly. A female cavalier identified as “Mathilda” was in the whelping box and had heavily matted ears and matted fur 
along the back legs. The extensive nature of these matted ears indicate they are over a week old and were not identified 
or addressed by the licensee. Weekly checks allow these dogs to be identified and have preventative care provided in the 
manner of grooming to reduce matted fur. The licensee needs to follow his veterinarians plan for the health of the dog.  
Correct by: Oct 5, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
